reviews.review: I love this game I would recomend the portal bundal so you can by portal 1 and2!

I really love this game, my friend told me that I would get irrated but, in the end, i was very satisfied with my gameplay.

P.S The story-line was good
P.P.S Graphics were good for a game at it's age 
P.P.P.S That's all i wanted to say.

Muss ich dazu noch mehr sagen? Ein wirklich tolles Spiel dem man die -jetzt schon- 8 Jahre nicht ansieht! Tolle Story, tolle Charaktere, etc. Lediglich ein paar Grafikbugs (wahrscheinlich von meinem "tollen" Pc ausgehend) waren enthalten. Weiterempfehlung? JA! KAUF ES DIR!
Classic, just try it out for yourself

Portal ist ein von Valve entwickeltes first-person-puzzlespiel, dessen schwierigkeit darin besteht, sich mit nur 2 Portalen durch viele, unterschiedliche Testkammern zu schlagen.
Ausgestattet mit fÃ¼r seine Zeit guter Grafik, einer simplen Steuerung, tollem Humor und einer gut funktionierenden Physik hat mich Portal fasziniert und ich konnte nicht aufhÃ¶ren, bis ich es durch hatte. Das Problem ist, dass das Spiel sehr kurz ist (ca. 5 Stunden, wenn man gut ist), weswegen man das Spiel schnell durchgespielt hat, und aufgrund des fehlenden MehrspielermodusÂ´, keinen Content mehr bietet. Wenn man das Spiel einmal durchgespielt hat, ist alles, was einem blebt, es nochmal durchzuspielen, was ich sehr schade finde. Das Spiel ist fÃ¼r 9,99â‚¬ allerdingst nicht zu teuer, da es einen schÃ¶nen Zeitvertreib darstellt, sich durch Testkammern zu rÃ¤tseln.
Ich kann das Spiel sehr empfehlen, da die Story abwechslungsreich und mit vielen verschiedenen Mechaniken geprÃ¤gt ist. 
Mein Rating: 8/10
Um bom jogo para passar o tempo.

Stupidly confusing.

I'll rate this
1 Companion Cube / 1 Companion Cube.

GLaDOS, the coldest person(?) I've ever known.
It teaches you how to be sarcastic. And even better, cruelly sarcastic.

Shoes that somehow save your legs after breaking a fall.

Portals. Infinite ways to look at your playermodel.

The cake is a lie. No really, don't listen when GLaDOS starts talking about your reward close to the end of the game.

My opinion, eh...
It's not bad, I guess? Well, it's confusing on my part, but it might actually be really entertaining for other people.
Wanna waste your time going through an infinite loop of portals? Then this is your game!

Puzzle game veramente simpatico e divertente. Mi ha affascinato tantissimo la possibilitÃ  di creare portali e teletrasportarmi da un lato all'altro di una stanza (inoltre fighissimo che se mettete due portali l'uno davanti all'altro potrete anche vedervi e svelare il mistero che si cela dietro la prima persona)
Unica pecca Ã¨ che la storia principale non Ã¨ molto lunga, anzi vi ritroverete in due o tre ore al massimo a leggere i titoli di coda. CiÃ  viene compensato dagli extra presenti nel gioco (sfide e mappe avanzate). Molto belle queste ultime perchÃ¨, nonostate siano nient'altro che una riproposizione di livelli della storia, offrono una sfida piÃ¹ impegnativa che mette alla prova il vostro ingegno
se dovessi dare un voto sarebbe un 7,5-8/10

My Portal Experience
----------------------
1. Opened the game
2. Had a blast using portals
3. Made an infinite fall using portals
4. Told me there would be cake
5. Met my love (Companion cube)
6. Killed my love
7. Cried
8. Found out there was no cake
9. Cried
10. Got my revenge
11. Got cake
I rate this game 11/ 10 would play this and the sequal again!

Just got Portal 1&2 on sale for a 5er in total, Amazing deal, Just after completing the Portal 1 and i already feel i have got my monies worth. Incredibily unique game that makes you think, Would highly recommend.

Portal is a game where you have to solve puzzles by using portals, cubes and gravity to your advantage. The clever map design and the interesting background of the story makes the game enjoyable and rewarding. There's not a better sensation than beating a puzzle and start a new one.

The game is fun, addictive and challenging; it may feel hard at sometimes but you just need to pay close attention to your environment. 

If you're looking for a good puzzle game with interesting mechanics... well, I must say that Portal is for you, and if you don't like puzzle games with interesting mechanics... I don't give a fuck, you must play it, period.

"The cake is a lie" -Random wall with lots of creepy messages.

In my opinion this game is way too short for â‚¬15, you better get it for 5 or less. The gameplay is really good, but it feels very clunky sometimes, for instance when you grab a cube and push it against the corner of a wall. Everytime I died, the game sound would kind of crash. The dialogue in this game is really good, although there is not that much.

I would give this game a 7/10. It's gameplay is the only reason you want to play this. But it's length and sometimes glitchy engine(?) , make it less amusing.

I played it in 2015 and i usually dont like old games due to bad graphics and bad physics but this game is just too good and infact better than many present day games . So if u haven't bought it yet its totally worth a try , i m sure u wont regret it ( and the song at ending credits made my day ) .

I have been waiting for ever to play portal ever since I tried portal 2 on ps3 . And for those who wish to play portal 2 I would recommend playing portal 1 first it helps you understand what happened somewhat better than just guessing . it took me about 4 hours to complete but i honestly didn't notice because how into the game I was. Great game if you like to be challenged.

Great game, love it!
Played this one at a friends house years ago, I already had 2 for some time and seen this on sale and bought it. Very good challenges and puzzles, Definately recommend it!

The combination of the music changing according to where you are and what you're doing and the villain being a disembodied voice that has the power to crush you at any time makes it feel as if there is someone constantly following you, but there isn't. Afraid to open doors in fear of a jumpscare only to remember you're the only living thing in there. And then a turret notices you. But when you finish you get serenaded with a lovely song about how much you suck. 10/10

All right so, when this game first came out in 2007 my dad and I thought it was a cool concept even though we weren't much of gamers, and through the years we heard all the fandom but money was still a little tight, during the sell I was so happy to get it dirt cheap ( I payed less then $3 for it ;) ) well I was surprised to beat it in just two hours but I think it was some of the most fun two hours I've had in a long while I can't wait to play through it with my dad when he gets home (he's on a little vacation seeing his new grandson) l suppose I should talk about the game though, although people have been talking about it for almost ten years. The mechanics or simple, puzzles are tricky at first then simple but fun. The voice acting is great, and I would recommend this game, I think the second one might be better but if you want you might as well get this one. Well I think all I can say is I am now a portal fan. I can wait to play is with my dad.

Es uno de los mejores juegos que e visto de valve

I first played Portal a couple of years ago. Lucky for me I didn't remember much beyond the first few levels and the credits song, so I got to discover the game all over again. I definitely recommend doing that, playing it again once your memory is fuzzy enough. Or let me know if you find a machine that can wipe my memory of Portal, that way I can experience it all again as if it was the first time.

Anyway, on to business, if you're unfamiliar with the Portal concept, it's  a puzzle game. The Portal gun gives the player an unique experience in solving environment based challenges. Getting ahead in the Aperture test chambers requires some creativity and occasional timing. But don't worry, GLaDOS will give you tips on the mechanics and will even host you a party with cake at the end!

All in all a worthwile experience. Now if you'll excuse me, me and my Companion Cube are going to have some cake.
this game is awsome

Sorry for my poor English,This game just a little opening for Portal 2.But you can't play Portal 2 without play this game,If you really do that,that mean you lost a lot of drama~
(The ending music and cake really moved me a lot,)

Que jogo divertido!!! Curto, dÃ¡ pra finalizar em 2~3 horas e tem puzzles excelentes! A histÃ³ria tbm Ã© incrÃ­vel e vai se revelando Ã  medida que vocÃª vai passando de fase atravÃ©s de frases curtas, objetivas e muuuuito engraÃ§adas. ParabÃ©s Valve!

Ok... the highly acclaimed Portal!

Graphics:
Basically the upgraded version of Half-Life 2's graphics. Fairly colourful and the portals still look pretty!

Story:
It's fairly bog-standard. You're a person in a facility. You have no memory. You try to escape.
Before you crucify me for saying it, let me continue. The monologues of Glados are great to listen to. The sense of humour is amazing and it even is able to make you feel bad for knocking over the turrets.

Gameplay:
They managed to make this game complicated with a very simple mechanic, which is the portal system. Basically a teleport system, which you use to solve puzzles with. One cool thing about it is that instead of using physics on other stuff to solve puzzles, you use physics on yourself to go through the puzzle.

Difficulty:
It's a puzzle game with no real help after the tutorial levels. For me it was fairly challenging, but I'm not really into puzzle games anyway. The game is about 2-3hrs and skilled players can finish it in even 1-2hrs.

Overall:
This is a good-looking puzzle game with a fair bit of humour. If you're into puzzle games get this game now. If you're not, get it during a sale. Remember: this game is short.

Score:
8.2/10

Malheureusement, le jeu est trop court et pas assez dur. Je n'ai galÃ©rÃ© qu'a un moment dans le jeu pour Ãªtre dÃ©bloquÃ© au bout d'une demi-heure. Au niveau de la durÃ©e de vie, j'ai fini le jeu au bout de 2h. Donc selon moi Portal ne vaut pas son prix. Je l'ai achetÃ© en reduction donc de ce cÃ´tÃ© lÃ  je n'ai pas a me plaindre.

Je le recommande donc aux gens qui ne s'attendent pas au plus gros blocbester du monde.
